IDUN Home

Microservice Repositories and Pipelines
Domain: lt_domain
App: $lt_app
Pods: ${lt_podlist}
Databases: ${lt_datname}

panels.title: Average Request rate per endpoint for $lt_app

panels.description: This is the sum of container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total / container_cpu_cfs_periods_total
panels.title: Average Container CPU Throttling Percentage

panels.description:
This is the container_cpu_usage_seconds_total rate per container for pods $lt_podlist.

This translates to cpu millisecond used per 1000milliseconds. 1 ms/second = 1 millicore
panels.title: Container CPU Core Usage

panels.description: This is the container_memory_working_set_bytes usage per container for pods $lt_podlist.
panels.title: Container Memory Usage

panels.description:
This is the container_cpu_cfs_throttled_seconds_total  per container for pods $lt_podlist. 

This represents the amount of millisceconds per 1000 milliseconds that a container has been throttled
panels.title: Container CPU Throttling

panels.description: This is the container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total / container_cpu_cfs_periods_total for pods $lt_podlist.
panels.title: Container CPU Throttling Percentage
work in progress - % memory of container_spec_cpu_quota
work in progress - % CPU of container_spec_cpu_quota

panels.description:
Number of logs handled per second, this value is dependent on the environment-specific configuration, but for XL deployments a max total of 4000 logs/s is expected - this is denoted by the red threshold on the graph.
lt_events_in, lt_events_filtered & lt_events_out should be aligned, and there should be no major discrepancies between the graphed lines.
panels.title: Log rate/s

panels.description:
The total time it takes to process lt_events_in -> lt_events_filtered -> lt_events_out. When no filters are applied this number should not exceed 500. When for example an exclusion filter is applied, events processing can take up to 1500 milliseconds.

Alert: >1500
panels.title: Events duration

panels.description:
The ratio of number of events going in and out of the pipelines. A number higher than 1 often indicates the output destination cannot handle the amount of events coming from Log Transformer.

Alert: >1
panels.title: Log Throughput Rate
WIP - New graph added - to be checked - rate lt_events_in_total / rate lt_events_out_total

panels.description: Graph showing in % JVM Memory used.
panels.title: JVM Memory Used

panels.description: Memory used apart from heap compared to committed bytes apart from heap.
panels.title: JVM Non-Heap Memory

panels.description: The used JVM heap should not reach the max JVM threshold.
panels.title: JVM Heap

panels.description:
A higher number indicates a form of back-pressure.

Alert: >0.25
panels.title: Queue Latency

panels.description: If the queue size reaches the max queue size threshold, this indicates a build of logs within the pipeline.
panels.title: Queue Size
